alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northern Gila County; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 5:27PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflow winds will impact areas from near Heber-Overgaard to Pinetop-Lakeside to Alpine through 600 PM MST... At 522 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm outflow winds along a line extending from 8 miles north of Taylor to near Pinetop-lakeside to 9 miles north of Greer. Movement was south at 20 mph. Winds near 40 mph were measured at the Show Low Airport! HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Gusty winds may also result in hazardous boating conditions. Locations impacted include... Show Low, Springerville, Eagar, Pinetop-lakeside, Taylor, Three Forks, Lake Of The Woods--Pinetop-lakeside, Nutrioso, Cutthroat Campground, Hondah, Alpine, North Fork, Clay Springs, Shumway, Rainbow City, Fort Apache Reservation, Wagon Wheel, Aripine, Linden and Whiteriver. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If on or near White Mountain, Sunrise, Crescent or Big Lakes...or Nelson Reservoir...head to shore as very hazardous boating conditions are likely with winds. Thunderstorm winds may not accompany rain, lightning, or thunder. Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm! Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northern Gila County; White Mountains
